label: Target Mapping
description: Maps protein targets to biological systems and assay metrics for calming-related cosmetic formulations.

defaultInputs.name: Target/Protein Input
defaultInputs.tooltip: Optional input port carrying protein names or biological descriptions from previous steps.

defaultOutputs.name: Desired Modulation
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Required modulation type (e.g. "Mild–moderate activation", "Low-level activation", "Sub-threshold modulation").

defaultOutputs.name: Corresponding Assay
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Specific assay method used to measure the target (e.g. "Cell-based olfactory receptor assay", "Calcium influx assay").

defaultOutputs.name: Metric Used
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Measurement unit for the assay result (e.g. "EC50", "IC50").

defaultOutputs.name: Rationale for Calming Association
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Biological rationale explaining why this target is relevant to calming effects.

defaultOutputs.name: Crystalized Structure Available?
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Whether a crystalized structure is available for the target ("YES" or "N/A").

defaultOutputs.name: ChemBL ID
defaultOutputs.tooltip: ChemBL database identifier for the target (e.g. "CHEMBL1075319").

configSchema.label: Target Input
configSchema.placeholder: Enter target name or biological effect (e.g., OR1A1, TRPM8...)
configSchema.tooltip: Use this when you want to type a target or biological effect manually instead of wiring it from another node.

mappingTable.corresponding_assay: Cell-based olfactory receptor assay (HEK293, cAMP or Ca²⁺ readout)
mappingTable.rationale_for_calming: OR1A1 responds to soft, pleasant odorants. Moderate activation supports smooth, familiar odor perception linked to reduced emotional arousal.

mappingTable.corresponding_assay: Heterologous OR expression assay with reporter gene
mappingTable.rationale_for_calming: OR2J3 is associated with fresh/green odor notes. Balanced activation contributes to emotional lightness without overstimulation.
Gentle TRPM8 engagement produces cooling and freshness that can bias autonomic tone toward relaxation when intensity is controlled.
TRPV3 contributes to warmth and comfort cues. Mild modulation supports safety and coziness rather than alertness.
